'''Oronzo Cilli''' is an Italian independent Tolkien scholar and researcher. 
He translated the second Italian edition of [[The Annotated Hobbit]] (Lo Hobbit annotato) in [[2004]].<ref>[https://tolkieniano.blogspot.com/p/hanno-scritto-di-e-tolkieniano.html Chi sono] on [https://tolkieniano.blogspot.com Tolkieniano](accessed 22 March 2023)</ref> He gained international notoriety after publishing [[J.R.R. Tolkien the Esperantist: Before the Arrival of Bilbo Baggins]] in [[2015]].<ref>[https://tolkieniano.blogspot.com/2016/11/tolkien-e-litalia-una-storia-lungo.html Tolkien e l'Italia una storia a lungo attesa!] on [https://tolkieniano.blogspot.com Tolkieniano](accessed 22 March 2023)</ref> His [[2019]] book [[Tolkien's Library: An Annotated Checklist]] won the [[The Tolkien Society Awards|Best Book Award]] from [[The Tolkien Society]] in [[2020]]<ref>[https://www.tolkiensociety.org/society/awards/ Awards] on [https://www.tolkiensociety.org tolkiensociety.org](accessed 22 March 2023)</ref> and was a finalist for the [[Mythopoeic Society|Mythopoeic Scholarship Award in Inklings Studies]] in [[2021]].<ref>[https://www.mythsoc.org/awards/awards-scholarship.htm Complete list of past finalists for the Myhtopoeic Scholarship Awards] on [https://www.mythsoc.org mythsoc.org](accessed 22 March 2023)</ref> In [[2023]] he curated the exhibition [[TOLKIEN - Uomo, Professore, Autore|Tolkien: Uomo, Professore, Autore]] (''"Tolkien: Man, Professor, Author"'').
